member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.TableEditEvent
member.summary: Defines a class that manages publication and subscription to events.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowCreatedEvent
member.summary: Occurs when a Row is created.
member.remarks:
The RowCreatedEvent is published during the execution of the edit operation. Any modifications performed within the RowEvent handler can cause cascaded events to be generated. Make sure you have an exit condition to avoid infinite recursion. For example, if you are changing a feature attribute within a RowCreatedEvent or RowChangedEvent, consider tracking that feature's objectID to ignore the corresponding RowChangedEvent your attribute change will generate.
If you need to edit additional tables within the RowEvent you MUST use the ArcGIS.Core.Data API to edit the tables directly. Do NOT use a new edit operation to create or modify features or rows in your RowEvent callback.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowCreatedEvent.Subscribe(System.Action{ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowChangedEventArgs},ArcGIS.Core.Data.Table,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes to RowChangedEvents that are published when a row is created. This method must be called on the MCT. Use QueuedTask.Run
member.param: The delegate that gets executed when the event is published.
The table to listen to.
(optional) The type of reference used to maintain the delegate. false is a weak reference, true is a strong reference. (default value = false)
member.returns: A token that uniquely identifies the subscription.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.RowCreatedEvent.Unsubscribe(ArcGIS.Core.Events.SubscriptionToken)
member.summary: Unsubscribe from RowCreatedEvents.
member.param: A subscription token that was returned by Subscribe.

The RowChangedEvent is published during the execution of the edit operation. Any modifications performed within the RowEvent handler can cause cascaded events to be generated. For example, if you are changing a feature attribute within a RowCreatedEvent or RowChangedEvent, consider tracking that feature's objectID to ignore the corresponding RowChangedEvent your attribute change will generate.
If you need to edit additional tables within the RowEvent you MUST use the ArcGIS.Core.Data API to edit the tables directly. Do NOT use a new edit operation to create or modify features or rows in your RowEvent callback.

member.summary: Provides access to the attribute values on features and rows.

This class is primarily used to get or set the attribute values on features or rows. Additionally it provides some meta information.
To get or set attribute values, first load a feature or row into the class then use the class properties or attribute index/name.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.HostDialog.NeedGeometryRefresh
member.summary: This was added as part of a workaround to bring the vertices grid back to the split pane. Currently, whenever split calls RefreshMessages(), it will trigger a HotSelectOperationEvent. When this is handled by the HotSelectViewModel, RefreshGeometry() will be called. Since split generates these events so often, this property was added to prevent unnecessary geometry refreshes. Original issue: /editing/issues/1012

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.HostDialog.IgnoreToolActivation
member.summary: this is a map-switching hack to allow EditFeatures to prevent tool de/activation within Initialize and Shutdown. Another way to do this would be to add a bool param to those methods, but those methods are used a *lot*, so this approach is simpler - time will tell if it works ok....

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener
member.summary:
define a listener for objects wishing to be considered for map-switching activities. Two differing workflows occur.
If the incoming and outgoing panes are different views of the same map, then only OnMapViewSwitched is called.
Otherwise it is assumed that switching occurs between two different maps, or a Map and a non-map view, and then, If the outgoing pane contains a map view then Save is called first. If the outgoing pane is not null, then CleanUp is called next. If the incoming pane contains a map view then OnMapSwitched is called.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener.GetID
member.summary: application-wide unique ID - DAML-ID is a good choice if available

member.summary: called when a mapview is switched away from, but not closed, and the incoming view is *not* the same map
member.returns: the state that this listener wishes to save

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IMapSwitchingListener.CleanUp
member.summary: called when a mapview is either switched away from (after Save has been called) or closed (in which case, there isn't a MapView to save)

the state that was provided by incoming map from a previous

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.RedoAsync

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsDone
member.summary: EditOperations are marked as Done when someone calls ExecuteAsync() on them (even before they are complete).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsSucceeded
member.summary: EditOperations are marked as Succeeded when ExecuteAsync() succeeds (the Task terminates with true).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.IsCancelled
member.summary: EditOperations are marked as Cancelled when they have been Executed but cancelled before completing and not performed.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.EditOperation.EventToken
member.summary: provides a way for calling code to identify a particular EditOperation within a subsequent EditEvent. Setting an EventToken in an EditOperation is optional - by default it is null. If set to a non-null object, the EditOperation is subsequently successful, and, an EditEvent is published, then the EventToken object set here, will be available from the corresponding .

member.summary: Gets if ground to grid corrections are enabled for supported tools.

member.summary: Gets if the direction offset will be used when ground to grid corrections apply within the currently active map.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UseScale
member.summary: Gets if the distance scale will be used when ground to grid corrections apply within the currently active map.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the UseScale property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.Direction
member.summary: Gets the direction offset angle in degrees that is used in ground to grid calculations.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the Direction property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.ScaleType
member.summary: Gets the type of scale that is used in ground to grid calculations.
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the ScaleType property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.ConstantScaleFactor
member.summary: Gets the constant scale factor used in ground to grid calculations, when equals
member.remarks: Subscribe to to be notified when the ConstantScaleFactor property is changed during the current sketch.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.GetGroundToGridCorrection(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map)
member.summary: Gets the GroundToGridCorrection for the given map.
member.remarks: This extension method of the class will automatically switch to the correct thread for the result.
member.param: The that has the required GroundToGridCorrection.
member.returns: A Task returning a for the given map, or null if there is currently none.
member.exception: map is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.SetGroundToGridCorrection(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Sets the GroundToGridCorrection for the given map.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class automatically switches to the correct thread to set the property. The map will not refresh after making the change. Calling code can listen to to be notified when a change is completed. An event is published when the new correction differs from the existing correction.
member.param: The that will have its GroundToGridCorrection set.
The that will be set.
member.returns: A Task returning true when a change has been made, and false when no change has been made.
member.exception: map is null or correction is null.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.ComputeCombinedScaleFactor(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute the combined scale factor using two points and using a z elevation at the mid-point between them.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class requires a map in a projected coordinate system, and assumes the x,y coordinates are in the map's and the z coordinate is in the map's . If the map has no ZUnit then the same unit for x,y is used for the z coordinate.
member.param: The map used to calculate the combined scale factor.
The x coordinate of the first point.
The y coordinate of the first point.
The x coordinate of the second point.
The y coordinate of the second point.
The z coordinate.
member.returns: A Task returning the calculated combined scale factor.
member.exception: map is null.

member.summary: Gets whether the ground to grid correction is turned on or off.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c != null && c.Enabled
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null and c is enabled, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingDirectionOffset(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether the direction offset will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.IsCorrecting() && c.UseDirection

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingDistanceFactor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether a distance factor will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.IsCorrecting() && c.UseScale
member.param: A obtained from
member.returns: true when c is not null, when c is enabled, and when the UseScale property is true; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingConstantScaleFactor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether a constant scale factor will be used in the ground to grid correction.
member.remarks: This extension method for the class is identical to: c.UsingScaleFactor() && c.ScaleType == GroundToGridScaleType.ConstantFactor

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.UsingElevationMode(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets whether a combined scale factor will be used in the ground to grid correction.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.GroundToGridCorrection.GetConstantScaleFactor(ArcGIS.Core.CIM.CIMGroundToGridCorrection)
member.summary: Gets the constant scale factor to be used in ground to grid calculations.

member.summary: Gets the of the annotation feature.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.TextString
member.summary: Gets and sets the annotation text string.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets and sets the horizontal alignment type used to align the text to the geometry. Affects which side of a point geometry the text is drawn or which end of a line it is drawn close to. Commonly used to define how stacked text appears.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets and sets the vertical alignment of the annotation.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.FontSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the font size.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.FontName
member.summary: Gets and sets the family name of the font. e.g. Comic Sans.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets and sets the style name for the font family. e.g. Regular, Bold or Italic.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.FontType
member.summary: Gets and sets the type of font that the font family/style name reference.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.Underline
member.summary: Gets and sets whether to draw the annotation with an underline.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.OffsetX
member.summary: Gets and sets the X offset.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets and sets the Y offset.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.Shape
member.summary: Gets and sets the text baseline shape.
member.remarks: The shape geometry represents the reference point or line for the annotation. Supported geometry types include point, line, multipoint and geometryBag.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.Angle
member.summary: Gets and sets the amount of rotation applied to the annotation around the geometry. This is only valid for point and two point polyline geometries. Measured in degrees.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.FlipAngle
member.summary: Specifies the angle, in degrees from the vertical, at which point rotated text is flipped, or mirrored, in place. At this point the text starting point becomes the ending point and conversly.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.WordSpacing
member.summary: Gets and sets the additional spacing that is added between the words of the text string. 100% indicates that regular spacing is used.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.CharacterWidth
member.summary: Gets and sets the character width.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Gets and sets the character spacing.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.FontEffects
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the annotation is drawn as subscript or superscript.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.TextCase
member.summary: Gets and sets the letter case used to draw the annotation.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.SmallCaps
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the annotation should be drawn as Small Capitals; where lower case is converted to small caps and upper case text is left as upper case.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.Color
member.summary: Gets and sets the color.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.TextGraphic
member.summary: Gets the representation of the annotation.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.AnnotationProperties.SymbolID
member.summary: Gets and sets the symbolID.

member.summary: Loads the specified text graphic into the annotation properties.
member.param: the text graphic to load.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.#ctor
member.summary: Defines the parameters used to create a parallel offset from line features.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Selection
member.summary: Sefines the lines to be copied from.
member.remarks: If non line features are in the selection, the copy will fail.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Template
member.summary: Gets or sets the template to create the copies in.
member.remarks: If a template is not specified, the copy will fail.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Distance
member.summary: Specifies the offset distance in map units. (Default value = 0)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Side
member.summary: Specifies on which side of selected lines the offset lines will be copied. (Default value = ParallelOffset.SideType.Both)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Corner
member.summary: Specifies the shape of corners created in the copied lines. (Default value = ParallelOffset.CornerType.Mitered)

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.Iterations
member.summary: Specifies the number of parallel offset copies to create. (Default value = 1)
member.remarks: The copies are created sequentially by the offset distance. For example, copying a line to one side specifying a distance of 5 and 2 iterations will create one line at 5 and one at 10 from the original line, not two lines at 5.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.AlignConnected
member.summary: Specifies If two or more connected lines should have their direction temporarily aligned for the purposes of the copy. (Default value = false)
member.remarks:
Use this setting to temporarily align the direction of connected lines in the selection to ensure the output features are created on a consistent side. The direction is random.
This setting has no effect on disconnected lines.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.CopyToSeparateFeatures
member.summary: Specifies if connected lines should be copied to separate lines. (Default value = false).
member.remarks:
This setting is only used if AlignConnected is true.
When set to true, this setting creates a separate line for each connected line in the selection, otherwise a single line is created.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder.RemoveSelfIntersectingLoops
member.summary: Specifies if self intersecting loops should be removed in the copied features. (Default value = True)
member.remarks: If AlignConnected and CopyToSeparateFeatures are True, this setting is required to be True else the edit operation will fail.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Create(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Builder)
member.summary: A class representing the parameters for copying parallel line features.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ParallelOffset.Selection
member.summary: Sefines the lines to be copied from.
member.remarks: If non line features are in the selection, the copy will fail.

The first time the property is changed we attach to the Loaded, IsVisibleChanged, GotFocus and LostFocus events.

Event data that is issued by any event that tracks changes to the effective value of this property.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableDescription.RowCount
member.summary:
The number of rows in the current view of the table.
This is the number of items in the DB table or the number of items in the OID cursor. The number of OIDs is used when we have a join that can have duplicate OID rows.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.EditingGroupTemplate
member.summary: Defines a grouping of existing s that can be used to create multiple features together.

remarks.para: This implementation of defines a grouping of one or more existing EditingFeatureTemplates, whose definable properties include the same properties as feature templates, together with properties that set the primary template and tool category, additional templates, and builders. Each EditingFeatureTemplate is stored within a Part along with the corresponding BuilderMethod.

You create features or temporary geometry with the primary template. The other templates in the group are assigned builders that autogenerate additional features based on the geometry of the feature or features you create in the map. For example, if you assign a water main template as the primary template, you create the water mains in the map, and other templates such as fittings, gate valves, and hydrants can be configured to autogenerate these features at locations based on the geometry of the water main.
Note: an EditingGroupTemplate cannot be added to another EditingGroupTemplate.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointIdentity
member.summary: Multiple point features builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type point and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer with the same geometry as the base point feature.
member.remarks: There are no option parameters required.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtEndOfLine
member.summary: Point at end of line builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from the end vertex of the base polyline feature. If no parameters are specified, a point feature in the component template layer is created at the end vertex of the base polyline feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtBeginningOfLine
member.summary: Point at beginning of line builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from the beginning vertex of the base polyline feature. If no parameters are specified, a point feature in the component template layer is created at the beginning vertex of the base polyline feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtBeginningOfRadial
member.summary: Point at beginning of line radial builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates a point feature in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from the beginning vertex of the base polyline feature. If no parameters are specified, a point feature in the component template layer is created at the beginning vertex of the base polyline feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.buidlerPointAtNotEndOfLine
member.summary: Point at every vertex, except end builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates point features in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from each vertex of the base polyline feature except the end vertex. If no parameters are specified, point features in the component template layer are created at each vertex of the base polyline feature except the end vertex.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.buidlerPointAtNotBeginningOfLine
member.summary: Point at every vertex, except start builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates point features in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from each vertex of the base polyline feature except the beginning vertex. If no parameters are specified, point features in the component template layer are created at each vertex of the base polyline feature except the beginning vertex.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtInteriorVertices
member.summary: Point at every vertex, except start and end builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates point features in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from each vertex of the base polyline feature except the beginning and end vertices. If no parameters are specified, point features in the component template layer are created at each vertex of the base polyline feature except the beginning and end vertices.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)
isProportional (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtAllVerticesOfLine
member.summary: Point at every vertex builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type point. Creates point features in the component template layer offset with the specified attributes from each vertex of the base polyline feature. If no parameters are specified, point features in the component template layer are created at each vertex of the base polyline feature.

Option parameters are required. The keys are
distanceValue (in meters)
proportional (between 0 and 100 inclusive)

offsetDistance (in meters)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderOffsetLine
member.summary: Multiple single-part lines builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type polyline. Creates a polyline feature in the component template layer offset with the specified distance from the base polyline feature. If no offset is specified (side = 0), a polyline feature in the component template layer is created with the same geometry as the base polygon feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderOffsetPrimaryLine
member.summary: Line feature builder. Available for use with a base template of geometry type polyline and a component template of geometry type polyline. If no offset is specified (side = 0), a polyline feature in the component template layer is created with the same geometry as the base polygon feature.
member.remarks:
Option parameters are required. The keys are
offsetDistance (in meters)
side (0 = None, 1 = Left, 2 = Right)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderBufferPolygonToPolygon

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderTwoPointLines

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtPolygonCentroid

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPointAtPolygonStart

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPolygonBoundary

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPolygonBoundaryTwoPoint

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.GroupTemplateBuilderMethods.builderPolygonIdentity

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Templates.EditingTemplate.CanBeGroupTemplatePart
member.summary: Gets whether this EditingTemplate can be included as part of a GroupTemplate.
member.remarks:
The current rules for including an EditingTemplate in an are:
the associated Layer must be of a type that is supported for feature editing,
templates for MultiPatch or MultiPoint feature Layers may not be included, and
a GroupTemplate may not be included in another GroupTemplate

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IEditingCreateToolControl
member.summary: this interface may optionally be implemented by an that is declared in DAML as belonging to the esri_editing_tool_options category
member.remarks:
An EmbeddableControl that implements IEditingCreateToolControl can be used for displaying Tool options within the Active Template pane as well as within the Template Properties Tools tab,
If the corresponding View must show differing information in the pane or tab, this can be handled by setting appropriate properties within InitializeForActiveTemplate and InitializeForTemplateProperties methods.
It's also possible to reuse the same EmbeddableControl and associated View for multiple Tools, which might be useful if several Tools have identical or very similar options. Each time the Initialize methods are called, the specified provides the current Tool ID as well as current Template, allowing the implementation to set appropriate properties.
The life-cycle of these controls is as follows
User opens the parent view - either TemplateProperties Tools tab, or Active Template pane
Either the default Tool is chosen or user clicks on a different Tool in the parent view
The View and control are constructed, View's DataContext is set to the control
or is called
is called
User interacts with the view and control
User clicks another Tool in parent View, or closes the parent view
is called
is called
for additional functionality when processing common tool options of multiple templates within Template Properties

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IEditingCreateToolControl.InitializeForActiveTemplate(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ToolOptions)
member.summary: called just before OpenAsync when this IEditingCreateToolControl is being used within the ActiveTemplate pane
member.param: tool options obtained from the template for the given toolID
member.returns:
true, when the implementation wants to display something in Active Template pane
false, don't display anything in Active Template pane
member.remarks:
The implementation can choose to display nothing in Active Template pane via the return value.
When is called, options won't be stored back into the CIM.

member.summary: the control can decide when its contents gets shown in the Active Template Pane at the moment that the specified tool is chosen
member.param: the ID of the current tool
member.returns:
true, when the specified tool is selected, the active template pane will be opened to the tool's options view
false, selecting the Tool changes nothing about the active template pane

member.remarks: If null is returned, then the Tool's small image that is defined in DAML will be used. The icon is displayed in a 24x24 pixel size, but it can be smaller if desired, and will be stretched

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IEditingCreateToolControl.InitializeForTemplateProperties(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.ToolOptions)

member.param: tool options obtained from the template for the given toolID
member.returns:
true, when the implementation wants to display something in Template Properties dialog
false, don't display anything in Template Properties dialog
member.remarks: Any required changes should be saved directly into the specified ToolOptions. After is called, the ToolOptions will then be saved into the Template.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IEditingCreateToolControl.IsValid
member.summary: When this IEditingCreateToolControl is being displayed in Template Properties dialog, calling code will use this property to determine if the current Template Properties may be saved.
member.returns:
true, when the implementation ToolOptions are valid and ready to be be saved to the CIM
false, implementation ToolOptions aren't ready to be saved to the CIM
member.remarks: When IsValid returns false, the Template Properties dialog disables the "OK" button, to prevent user from saving invalid template data.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.IEditingCreateToolControl.IsDirty
member.summary: When this IEditingCreateToolControl is being displayed in Template Properties dialog, calling code will use this property to determine if any changes have been made.
member.returns:
true, when the implementation ToolOptions have been modified
false, implementation ToolOptions haven't been modified
member.remarks: When IsDirty returns true, clicking "OK" in the Template Properties dialog will ensure the Tool Options are written to the CIM.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TopologySubtractFeaturesCommand.OnClickAsync_Test(System.Tuple{System.Boolean,System.Boolean,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.esriTopologySelectedFeature})
member.summary:
This is used for MVVM testing. The predefined selection is applied to all errors:
The predefined selection must be specified as follows.
Tuple{bool Fix/Skip, bool multiple/single, selection)} selection can be esriTopologySelectedFeature.originFeature or esriTopologySelectedFeature.destinationFeature
{true, true, selection} => Apply selection to all remaining fixes {true, false, selection} => Apply selection to next fix only {false, true, selection} => Skip all remaining fixes {false, false, selection} => Skip the next fix only

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ElevationSurfaces
member.summary:
Provides a portal into the Elevation Surface native code.
Queries for elevation are not awaitable because we want them to run within the Global Utility ThreadPool and not block any of the Dispatcher or CIM threads unnecessarily. The calling/thread pattern is typically like this: UI --> managed(QuerySurfaceMapPoint) --> Dispatcher --> native(CIM) --> native(Global TP) --> native(CIM) --> managed(QueryService/Sync) --> QueryCache callback
The CIM really only gets involved when Geometrys are de/serialized
Note: this class is public so that it can be used by other assemblies, e.g. ArcGISAnalyst3D, but isn't intended to be exposed to the SDK.

member.summary: Starts an elevation surface query which may take considerable time. The x and y values refer to a point in Map SpatialReference. Z will eventually be returned in the Map SR.
member.returns: a task that eventually returns true == the query successfully started in a background thread, or false == some error occurred and query did not start
member.param: the map containing the surface to be queried
the ID of the map surface to be queried
the x ordinate of the query point, assumed in the map's spatial reference
the y ordinate of the query point, assumed in the map's spatial reference
can be used to cancel a running query

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ElevationSurfaces.QuerySurfaceGeometry(ArcGIS.Desktop.Mapping.Map,System.String,ArcGIS.Core.Geometry.Geometry)
member.summary:
Starts an elevation surface query for the given map, surface ID and input geometry.
If the query starts in a background thread, then the return is true, and when it completes, the callback will be invoked with the result, otherwise the return is false, and the callback will not be invoked.
member.returns: a task that wraps either true == the query successfully started in a background thread, or false == some error occurred and query did not start

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.ErrorInspectorToolbarSettings
member.summary:
Base class to handle toolbar settings. Settings are saved when an error source is deactivated (toolbar is hidden) and restored when an error source is reactivated (ie the toolbar reappears) This base class handles two basic settings - IsMapExtentFilterOn, IsExceptionsFilterOn. The expectation is that your toolbar (if your error source requires one) will display controls allowing the user access to modifiy these settings. Each toolbar has a single settings instance and it should be created in the constructor of your toolbar.
Inherit from this class if necessary to add your own settings relevant to your toolbar controls.

member.summary: Name and image are currently displayed in the error Inspector Source dropdown

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.AllRowsContextMenuID
member.summary: Contet menu to appear when a row is right clicked in the row indicator in the error inspector when table is in 'ShowAllRecords' mode. Default context menu is "esri_editing_errorInspectorRowContextMenu". Set this property in your constructor if you want a different context menu to appear (or no row context menu).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.SelectedRowsContextMenuID
member.summary: Contet menu to appear when a row is right clicked in the row indicator in the error inspector when table is in 'ShowSelectedRecords' mode. Default context menu is "esri_editing_errorInspectorRowContextMenu". Set this property in your constructor if you want a different context menu to appear (or no row context menu).

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.ShortcutTableID
member.summary: Shortcut table for error source. By default no shortcut table is set. Set this property in your constructor if you want a shortcut table. See esri_editing_shortcutList_topologySource_errorInspector for an example.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.BurgerButtonMenuID
member.summary: Context menu for burger button. By default no burger button is visible. Set this property in your constructor if you want a burger button. See esri_editing_burgerMenu_topologySource_errorInspector for an example

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._columnWidthsByFieldName
member.summary: Allows overriding of the default column widths by tableControl. Add to this collection in your constructor if you want to increase (or decrease) a column width

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._orderedFields
member.summary: List of fields in the order they are to be displayed. Passed to the tableControl. Set this ONLY if you want to override the default order of your error source table fields. Specify the fields you want to order. All other fields will be listed in the order they are defined in the table.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._hiddenFields
member.summary: list of fields initially hidden on the main inspector table. Passed to the tableControl. By default all fields in your error source table are displayed. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to hide fields (objectID for example). Use ActiveTableControlVM.UpdateFieldVisibility to add/remove from this collection at runtime (via a burger button for example)

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._resourceKeysByFieldName
member.summary: List of resources (value converters) used to customize column display in the error inspector grid. By default no customization of fields is performed. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to customize field display. For example, the topology error source translates the TopoRuleType from an integer to a string with the rule description

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._detailsTabResourceKeys
member.summary: List of resources (value converters) used to customize column display in the Details tab. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to customize field display. For example, the topology error source translates the TopoRuleType from an integer to a string with the rule description

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._tabs
member.summary: List of tabs ids to be displayed on the RHS of the error inspector (preview, details, fix etc). Ids need to be registered with esri_editing_ErrorInspector_Tabs. Add to this collection in your constructor if you wish to display information tabs. Note that at least 1 information tab is required.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._shapeFieldName
member.summary: Shape field name of error source

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._lengthShapeFieldName
member.summary: ShapeLength field name of error source. Note that if you only have point errors then LengthShapeFieldName will be empty

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._areaShapeFieldName
member.summary: AreaShape field name of error source Note that if you only have point errors then AreaShapeFieldName will be empty

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetShapeFieldNames
member.summary: Determines the shape, shapeLength, shapeArea fields for your error source. Override this function if you need to determine these fields from something other than the ErrorMapMember. Call this function in your constructor.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.CanToggleEditorTrackingFields
member.summary: Indicates if the error source allows the editor tracking fields to be displayed. By default these fields (if they exist) are hidden and cannot be displayed. Override this property in conjunction with making the esri_editing_errorInspectorToggleEditorTracking button available on a menu or toolbar to allow the user to toggle the editor tracking fields

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.OnSourceActivate
member.summary: Opportunity for you to perform some action when your error source object is chosen in the dropdown and activated. For example, when a topology source is chosen it updates the topology source dropdown on the EDIT tab to match.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.OnSourceDeactivate
member.summary: Opportunity for you to perform some action when your error source object is de-activated in the source dropdown.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.SubscribeToEvents
member.summary: Opportunity for you to subscribe to events. This method is called when your source is activated or the error inspector is made visible with your error source current.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.UnSubscribeFromEvents
member.summary: Un-subscribe from events subscribed to in SubscribeToEvents. This method is called when your source is deactivated or the error inspector hides or is closed.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetRowData(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieve the row data for your error source for a particular oid. This routine is called every time the activeRow changes. Override this method if you need specific information from your table row for other functions such as GetErrorFeature. Create a class inheriting from ErrorInspectorRowData and return this populated appropriately. For example, the active row information for a topology error can be found in the TopoInspectorRowData class.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetErrorFeature(ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.ErrorInspectorRowData)
member.summary: Returns the layer and oid of the error feature. Override this if your implementation of ErrorInspectorRowData has additional or different error information. For example, topology errors contain a virtual oid linked to the topology composite layer (since it is a combination of the point, line and polygon error tables). The TopoInspectorRowData object (inherits from InspectorRowData) contains additional information which holds the real oid relative to the appropriate error sub layer (point, line, polygon error). The topology implementation overrides this method to return the real error oid and layer rather than the virtual oid with the composite layer.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetErrorFeatures(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Returns a dictionary of layers and oids for the set of specified oids. Override this implementation if your ErrorMapMember does not contain the true error features. For example, in the topology implementation the ErrorMapMember is a topology composite layer. The error features are contained in the topology sub layers (point, line, polygon errors).

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetSourceFeaturesForErrors(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Returns a dictionary of layers and oids which contributed to the set of errors specified in the set of oids. This default implementation returns an empty dictionary Override this method if you can determine the source features. In the topology implementation this returns the set of features which are feature1 and feature2 displayed in the inspector table.

member.name: F:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError._hiddenDetailsFields
member.summary: The list of hidden fields on the details tab.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.SetupHiddenDetailFields
member.summary: Set up the list of hidden fields on the details tab.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetDetailsDataForField(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TableGridRow,ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TablePaneField,System.Collections.Generic.List{ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.TablePaneField})
member.summary:
Determine if the field specified should be displayed in the Details tab. The visibility of the field in this tab may be independent of the field's visibility in the inspector table. In addition provides the ability to change the display data value of the field from the raw value (similar to a value converter). Override this function if the visibility or display value of the field is to be different.
For example, topology errors always show the shape area and length fields in the Details view regardless of geometryType and whether the columns are displayed in the inspector table.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.ExceptionFieldName
member.summary: The exception name field. Override if your exception field is different from 'IsException'

member.summary: Override this method to provide your implementation of mark as exception for a specific row in the table. It is expected that your class inheriting from ErrorInspectorRowData holds a property indicating the error/exception state of the row. This method is called by the command attached to the checkbox on the Details tab.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.ErrorInspector.InspectorError.GetRefreshStateOnEditCompleted(ArcGIS.Desktop.Editing.Events.EditCompletedEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called within OnEditCompleted event. Determines if rows in the table need to be refreshed. If a refresh is required, also determine if the activeRow is to be retained This default implementation uses the following logic refresh is required if features are created, deleted or modified in the ErrorMapMember active row is retained if features are modified in the ErrorMapMember
Tuple values to be returned are item1 - is a refresh of the table rows required item2 - is the activeRow to be retained

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.RefreshTable
member.summary:
Refreshes the table properties. Thin Wrapper on the RefreshTableProperties.
Logic: - Exit if already refreshing. - (_isRefreshingTable) - Set _isRefreshingTable to true. - Set _resetTableOnRefresh to true. - Calls RefreshTableProperties with true.
Class Variable used - _isRefreshingTable - Used to prevent recursion. - _resetTableOnRefresh - Used to reset the table of refresh.
Early Exits Already refreshing, (RefreshTableProperties)
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.ResetRows(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the _activeRowObject = null, but does not fire Notify property changed event. - Clear the _savedRow and _loadSavedRow. - Sets the _rowsResetting to true - Reset the current row object. - Fires collection change events. - The internal row update uses the dispatcher and the event is not awaitable.
member.param: If resetActiveRowCol is true: Clears the ActiveField, while keeping the current _activeFieldIndex and sets the _resetActiveRowIndex to 0.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.ResetTable
member.summary: Resets the table (Reinitialized the native table) and calls DelayedRefreshTable. Checks for TestMode and calls RefreshTable Directly
member.remarks:
Logic: - Check to see if the table is not initialized and exits. - (!_isTableInitialized) - CancelActiveTasks - Cancels cancellable tasks, like loading counts. - Updates the schema number - Resets native table - Check to see if the request is valid and exits, if not. - Sets the _sourceUpdating = true; - Makes DelayedRefreshTable or RefreshTableProperties if in TestMode
Class Variable used - _isTableInitialized - Used to cancel work - _schemaId - Increases value - _sourceUpdating - sets to true before refreshing.
Early Exits Table not longer valid, (!_isTableInitialized) Table exception - close table on error and exit.
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.RefreshRows
member.summary:
Refreshes the rows of the table.
Logic: - Exit if not ready - !IsValidTableId || !_isTableInitialized || _isTableUnInitializing - Set Busy to true - Get Table counts from native service. - Jump To UI - Update the class count variables (does not fire row collection changes) - Calculates the current row and column indexes. - Reset the current row collection. (fires row collection changes) - Set Busy to False - Dirties the project. - Calls OnFilterCompleted on the table callback.
Class Variable used - IsValidTableId - Check valid state - _isTableInitialized - Check valid state - _isTableUnInitializing - Check valid state - IsWaitingForRowRefresh - Check valid state - _tableCallback - Inform of filter change.
Early Exits - Invalid state - Error - Fires Fatal Error to close the table.
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Internal.Editing.TableControlCoreViewModel.RefreshTableProperties(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Refreshes the table. Logic: - If not reconnecting and not on ui and not in test mode, then the call jumps to the UI thread. - Check to see if the request is valid and exits, if not. - (!_isTableInitialized || _tableIsClosingOnError || !_refreshMonitor.CanContinue) - Cancel any edits being done by the table. - Sets the busy flag - if _restablishActiveCellAfterRefresh, call calculate indexes. - CancelActiveTasks - Cancels cancellable tasks, like loading counts. - Resets native table, if _resetTableOnRefresh - Refreshes the table description values, by calling get table info. - Updates the caption - if _sourceUpdating || isReconnecting - Updates the count variable, fire notifications (Not collection changes). - Updates is editable - Check to see if the request is valid and exits, if not. - Call RefreshTablePropertiesUI with new count.
Class Variable used - _isTableInitialized - Used to cancel work - _tableIsClosingOnError - Used to cancel work - _refreshMonitor.CanContinue - Used to cancel work - _resetTableOnRefresh - Calls native service ResetTable - ReInitializes the table making it ready for the next data request - Set in the RefreshTable() and OnFieldDescriptionsChanged - _restablishActiveCellAfterRefresh - Calculate current row and field indexes. - set in EndEditAsync(), ReconnectTable(), DelayedRefreshTable() - Cleared in LoadActiveCellState() - _sourceUpdating - Updates count and is editable
Early Exits Table exception - close table on error and exit. Table not longer valid, (!_isTableInitialized || _tableIsClosingOnError ) A pending table refresh request is encountered or has been cancelled, !_refreshMonitor.CanContinue
member.param: Flag indicating that the table is reconnecting.
member.returns: Awaitable Task.

member.summary: Updates the count related properties.

Update the table descriptions IsCountKnown property.
member.returns: The number of rows in the current view of the table.
